WILLOW.raw_line: I can't run off and play with you now. I've got work to do.Back! Don't go near it. We don't know where it's been. It could be diseased.No, it's too big to be a Nelwyn baby. It looks like a daikini...Mims! Get back here! It might bite you.Absolutely not.Shhh, shhh! It's the Prefect -- that's all I need. Mims, Ranon, keep this thing hidden...In the forest. My family's been gathering them since last fall. There's no law against that, Bur- glekutt.Absolutely, under no condition, is anyone in this family going to fall in love with that baby.Kiaya! We can't keep that baby. Mims, Ranon. Hey! I will not be ignored!This is bad. If we're caught with that little daikini it'll be the end of us. Careful, Ranon, I need that for the festival. Kiaya, what are we going to do?Burglekutt's right. There's not enough time to finish plowing. We'll lose everything and I'll end up working in the mines.No, no! They'll think it's a bad omen. There'll be a flood or a drought or a plague and everybody'll blame me for it!I don't know. This is trouble. I'll talk to the High Aldwin about it tomorrow at the Festival.And now! For our final amazing bit of magic, I will make an entire pig completely disappear!Meegosh, I'm in trouble.Mining. I hate closed-in spaces. That's the last thing I'd ever do. I gotta get my crop planted.Meegosh, can you watch the chil- dren? I gotta talk to the High Aldwin.Sir! I have to talk to you.It's a matter of great importance to me!Kiaya! Kiaya!We can't keep this baby, Kiaya. We must take her to the Council.My family found this baby in the river, High Aldwin.They'll kill her! We can't let this baby die!I can't do it! I haven't put my crop in!Yes.I will, Mims. Goodnight.Daikinis are giant people who live far far away.What a great son you are, Ranon. I wish I could take you with me. Now go to sleep...If I'm not strong enough to be your apprentice, how can I do this?I don't want courage. I don't want to be a warrior. All I've ever wanted was to do magic, real magic, like you!Oh, if I could do that I'd--I'd turn Burglekutt into a toad!You cut your hair, Kiaya?I hate this. Where am I? I should stick you in a tree and go back home. I'm sorry. I didn't mean that.That's it. The crossroads...I hate this.I hate this.I really hate this.I will--I'll getcha water--getcha lotsa water--anything you say--!I'm not coming near you!Good. How long will it take?You be careful. I'm a powerful sorcerer. I could turn you into a toad just like that.Do any other daikinis ever come by here?I have to give this baby to some- body.No. Somebdoy put you in there for a reason. I'll wait for somebody else.Hey! Somebody's coming!Are you okay?I don't know.Don't call me a Peck. My name is Willow.Farmer.Nooo, I don't think I should.You all right?See if this helps.What's inside?Stop! Wait!Are you a warrior?What's that? I hear something!What is it?Sir? Sir!Sir! Sir! I have this baby. We found her in our village. Will you take her...?Friend of yours?I hate this.You don't know anything about ba- bies.You gotta promise to feed her.Fresh goat's milk.And give her a bath everyday, and don't let her get cold. And keep her diaper changed.Here are her diaper rags. And this is her milk bladder. And when she cries--she's either hungry or she's tired--rock her on your left shoulder. She likes that.Bye.Please take good care of her.Look, it's Willow Ufgood! He's come home! Welcome back, Willow! He deserves a medal: he's quite mystical. For honor, for bravery, for his intuitive powers... ...let's make him Apprentice Aldwin. Better still: High Aldwin! Make way! It's Willow Uf- good, High Aldwin of---Come back here, you! That's my baby!!Oh no, it's a trap!Oh noooooo!!Where am I? Where's the baby?That baby's my responsibility!Yeow! Madmartigan...I never should've trusted you...Who are you?Queen Cherlindrea?Who??Why??I'm getting her out of there!I can't go out there with the baby!Ohhh, I hate this.Why not?Trolls?This is not going well.Yes...?I can't see anything--she's too bright!You mean, you know who this baby belongs to?What a relief. Now I can go home.Me?What is Tir Asleen?Where is Tir Asleen? How far is it?You need a warrior for this job. I'm nobody.No I'm not. Have you really looked at me? I'm short! Even for a Nelwyn!Why can't you do it? You have mag- ical powers.They look like acorns.They're magic? Are you serious?But I've got a family to think about! They need me!Hello...?I'll do it. Yes, I will, I'll do it!But I only have one shoe.Wait till I tell my children. Stuff like this never happens in my village.How do these work I wonder? I got- ta save one to show the High Aldwin.Daikinis...Let's get out of here. Shhh, don't cry, Elora. Things can't get any worse than this...Don't worry--I'm a sorcerer. What could possibly happen?Could you spare some milk for this poor hungry baby?I could use your help, boys.This is not fun.Woah!You!!I trusted you...Hey! Give me that baby!Nursemaid?!Time to change her diaper.No! You can't!Because she's sick.Madmartigan! Wait!We could've been killed, Madmarti- gan!Heeyah! Heeyah!Oh no!Woah...woah...!Where's the baby??Elora Danan!Madmartigan! You saved her life!Let's get out of here before they come back.Yes it does. The Fairy Queen told me.Madmartigan, I need your help.But you're a great swordsman!You're not a warrior, Madmartigan! A warrior wouldn't lie there and do nothing!We're in trouble! You've seen the big army that's after us! You're a fake! You're a bum! You're a-- you're a coward!!I miss my wife! I miss my chil- dren! My boy Ranon! He's growing up so fast, he even helps me on the farm now! And little Mims! If you ever saw her sweet little face you'd *melt* Madmartigan, you'd *melt*! Or maybe you wouldn't. You don't know anything about love. You don't know anything about any- thing...You?Madmartigan! Madmartigan!How are we going to get out there?We need to get out to that island.We've traveled a long way. We're looking for Fin Raziel.What would the Fairy Queen say?Without Raziel we'll never find Tir Asleen. We'd better go.Raziel? Hello? Fin Raziel?I'm Willow Ufgood. I'm here to find Fin Raziel.This can't be right. This isn't a sorceress. This is some kind of animal.We need your help. To take this baby to Tir Asleen. She's a prin- cess.Madmartigan!Help, Madmartigan! The oar!No!I can't go on...No.I'll help you...!That's all I ever wanted!If you rest the baby on your shoulder, she'll stop crying.What do I need for that?I hope she's all right. How much more do I have to do of this?I know, and the magician's goal is to find his true self. But what's this got to do with it?The universe is a living creature, like you and me, Madmartigan.I'm all finished. Now what?How am I gonna do that?What's going on?She needs to be changed.She needs to be changed again. Sorsha crosses her arms in a hugg and watches as Willow changes the baby. Soon the baby stops crying. Re- lieved yet still anxious, Sorsha paces to a mirror. Willow rocks the baby gently, absently looking at the fire. Then his eyes focus on the fire.Madmartigan.I don't know much about him.Uh, yes. It's very nice hair.She's hungry.Here. Hold her.Sometimes she likes it heated.She's a good baby.I did it! I got the ashes!Who?She said lots of thing.sShe asked about you, Madmartigan.You're crazy. I think you're in love.I must concetrate my imagination...to creat a new...reality!The limitless power of...I can't remember all these things. What am I learning?But what am I gonna transform??You?I'll do it, Raziel...Oooh, this smells terrible.Ouch!!What'd you bit me for!!His will.I just wanted to test it first.Avaggdu, supriom, luwatha...What did I do?Madmartigan. Let's go. Let's get Eloran Danan.Come on, Madmartigan...!What are you doing? Get out of there...!Nooo!!!The princess, Elora Danan.We're taking her to Tir Asleen. She'll be safe there from Bavmorda's powers.Madmartigan! I can't stand being in closed-in places.I'm used to her. How's she doing?She can't be wrong. She's a very very very powerful sorceress.That's my fault, not hers. I've got to keep practicing. I'm still in the learning stage but magic, Madmartigan, requires concentration and--Ahhh!I hate this.There's nobody here.How??Beings within, beings without! Danu danu walkail funfawtha!I did it! Madmartigan! Come here! Look! You gotta see this! I did it!Tuatha tuatha danu!Raziel! I transformed them all! I'm a magician!I feel like I could do anything!Capture the enery...limitless power of the will...avvdachh doth indicht rredd baerkinhaekin!Raziel? Is that you? Oh-oh. What happened?I'm sorry. There were too many of them.Why?I've come all this way and now Elora Dana's going to die!She's too powerful, RazielBanish all disturbing forces from this place. Fire, water, above and below. Balance. Balance. Bal- ance.Raziel!Wait!!I have an idea. Back in my village we catch a lot of hedgehogs.I know, I know! But this is a way to get into that castle...Madmartigan, you promised me you'd take care of Elora Danan like your own daughter. She is all that matters. Are you going to abandon her?Me, too.Surrender!!We are all-powerful magicians! Give us the baby or we will destroy you!!Courage, Willow.I'm Willow Ufgood. I'm a magician.I'm a *great* magician.No. You can't have her.And with my magic I'll send her into the...into the...Into the good.It was just the old disappearing pig trick.Your dream has come true, madmarti- gan.Farewell, Elora Danan.Kiaya!!

MADMARTIGAN.raw_line: Hey, Peck...get me some water...or you'll diiiiie...!Peck!You're a weasely little Peck! Gimme some water!Please? I'm dyin' of thirst in here.Don't make me angry, Peck.Miserable Pecks.That's more like it.Why.I'm somebody. Lemme out and I'll take care of your baby.Peck! Quick! Douse the fire!No, you fool! Put it out I say! Out!No!!No! Help! Stop!Thanks for your help, Peck.As if you care. I saved your life, Peck. Those guys woulda killed us! You wanna give your baby to them?? They eat babies!The world's gone insane. Good men locked in cages, criminals running free. It doesn't pay to be honest, Peck.Hello, Willow. I'm Madmartigan.You a woodcutter?Farmer! I knew it! You're a vic- tim, Willow. Yep, you and me: victims of a rotten, corrupt, cor- rupt, rotten world.Listen, Willow my friend. I'm really a good man. Give me my freedom, and I'll look after that baby for you. Trust me.That's it--good--good--like that, yes, good, good, the chain--that's it, come on--come on--!Peck!! Stupid Peck! I'll kill ya! Let me out!Morning, Willow.Sorry I yelled at you. I've been in this cage toooo long. Can't think straight anymore. Owww...!These burns. My arms. Ouch...Aaaaaahhhh. Better. Here, I made something for the baby.A tooth. I'm strving. I got no used for it.Smells like a battle.The greatest swordsman that ever lived.You hear trouble.A hundred horses...five or six wagons... and about six thousand fools.He thought you were a woman, Airk!Nothing you wouldn't have done it my place!Least I'm not down there herding sheep!Airk! Come on, Airk. Lemme outa here.Gimme a sword, Airk. I'll win your war for you.I'll be around long after you're dead, Airk! You slime! When I get outa here I'll cut your head off and stick it on a pig-pole!Hello, little baby...Whatcha thinkin' about, Willow?Nobody's gonna take your baby. Know why? Nobody cares... Except me. You wanna go back to your farm. You wanna go back to your family. I could take care of that baby. I'll look after her like she was me own.Ahhh! But I know a lot of women who do. Why, if I had somebody in my life--a little daughter for instance--I'd have a reason to live...Willow. You can't let me die here. Not when I wanna help you.I will.Absolutely!Of course! I promise!Come to Daddy, little darlin'. I think she likes me!Don't worry, Willow. She's in good hands. You haven't made a mistake.You've done a great job. Now you go back to your family and get your crop in.Where the hell did you come from?You're crawling with rodents.How do you do.These Pecks make terrible nurse- maids.They get too excited.Time to leave.No. I mean yes.I can't.I can't.Why not?Because she's sick.Gawd...you're...beautiful...That girl is a vision.I thought you had her!Now Willow, I know you're gonna blame me for this but it wasn't my fault...!When I left the crossroads, I got ambushed by an elf!I did?I mean, of course I saved her life. She's almost my daughter, isn't she?Not a bad idea.So you're on your way to Tir Asleen, huh? I hate to tell you this, Willow, but Tir Asleen dosn't exist.The Fairy Queen? And the baby here's a princess? And these two rodents are your guides?Yeah well...in the morning I think I'll be on my way.My help? A great magician like you? You don't need any help.What's with you, Peck?I was in love once, Willow. She had a hold on my heart. I could barely function. I *was* a great swordsman! I was knighted! I could have been king!Yeah me. King! But she betrayed me. She robbed me of my dream.I'll never fall in love again...Relax, Willow. We're having fun.Gold!!We'll find a way, Willow. Look over there--that looks like a village--maybe they've got a boat. Come on, what are you waiting for?Give me a hand here, Peck!It's nothing to do with you.Yeah? Who cursed it?Ahh, he's trying to protect the gold. Come on, Willow. Jump in.Rool! Teemo! You were right! This whole tree is made of gold!!Wait! Gold! Gold!My gold!No!! Help!! Willow!!!Willow...you...you got...magic...! Wait...we could team up...!Don't worry, Willow. If there's one thing I'm good at, it's charm- ing a woman...So. Couldn't live without me, huh?Still got what counts.Willow, why don't you use your mag- ic to get us out of here?He turned that monster into stone!Then you get us out of here.I won't.Nice horse...nice hair...real nice hair...I'd say you've got the most beautiful hair I've ever--Mmmm, I love the smell of a woman.I'm torn apart already. I mean it! Under all that armor is a beautiful--Who is that girl, anyway?Forget that one, Madmartigan.Now that's a woman...!You got that one covered.I'm beginning to think you two *deserve* to be locked up.We're a tiny version of all that?Hurt him and you'll answer to me!Did she ask about me?Come on, Peck, don't give me a hard time. You were in her ten all night. Did she say anything?Willow!Well what did she say?She's in love.What are you gonna become, Raziel? Queen of the rodents?What do *you* call it?Too bad you're not more like your father.We gotta get the baby out of here.Not bad, Peck. I'm impressed. You busted the lock.Let's get Elora Danan.You're a magician, Willow. But I'm a thief. Wait here. I'll get the baby.I love you.I'm not going to let this baby die.I believe you would...Say what?Because it's true.I wish it weren't true. I swore I'd never let this happen. I hate you. I hate your beauty, I hate your innocence, I hate the feelings you've awakened in me.I'm in love with you, Sorsha. I don't want to be, but a power has enchanted me and I stand helpless against it. It's torture. Battle- field or prison cell was never half as cruel.I want you and I can't have you so I want you all the more. If this were another time and another place I'd--Whoops!Willow! Jump on the shiled!Sorsha! I didn't betray you. I love you!Willow! Willow! Are you all right?Help us.You left me to die, friend.Is this what's left of your army?You'll draw the others.They're not after me. They want the baby.Then come with us.Just get me some horses.Once again, Airk, we say goodbye.Want me to carry Elora?She's doing a lot better than we are, Peck.Willow...this may be a bad time to ask this question but...what if Raziel's wrong?She's a bird, Willow.Watch it!Go, Willow! Run! Run!Willow! Willow!Hurry, Willow! Throw it!Sorsha.Whose side are you on?Out for a little ride in the coun- try, Airk?Thank you, friend.Sorsha! Any way in there?We've come for Elora Danan! Turn her over to us!Can you use your magic to get our men into the fortress, Raziel?Willow, this is war, not agricul- ture!I don't know, Willow.We'll probably die here, Sorsha.Time is running out. We must now decide who's going to leave and who is going to stay...Airk!!Airk! Airk!Madmartigan...you're a brave warrior...a true friend...a good man...We're gonna win this war, Airk.Goodbye, Peck.

RAZIEL.raw_line: Get away! Get away!You'll die! You'll die!Who are you! Who are you!That's me! Raziel! Raziel!What do you want!Elora Danan!Fools! You should never have come to this place! We're all going to die!We've got to get off this island right now. Hurry! The boat! It's our only chance!Kill him!Kill him!Flee! Flee!He's no magician.Did *you* give that acorn its power?A magician *makes* magic. Any fool can use it.I will! But I need help!You must learn magic.Then I will teach you.Sorsha, Queen Bavmorda's daughter.Willow. To learn magic, first you must make your own philosopher's stone!We must start with feathers, dung, and a lock of your hair.Keep working at it. Forget all you know, or think you know. A magician's power depends on disord- er of the mind.Till it's in a powder. The energy exits within you...As below, so above. You hold the univers, Willow, in your hand.As above, so below.Burn it to a fine ash.Patience. Concentrate. You will find a way.Good! The first step is complete.We don't have much time left! Go on! Go on!What's the magician's weapon?Your will! Your will! What else could it be?The art of transformation!Me!You remind me of your father, Sor- sha.He was a great king. Not like your step-father, not like your mother. He ruled Tir Asleen with kindness, and a generous heart.Tonight! Complete the philosopher's stone! I must be turned back!Let it settle. Carefully, slowly. Concentration and will. Now pour the water off.That's the life spark. Exxence of magic and sorcery!Shhhhh!We need blood. To nourish the stone. charge the stone with ener- gy.The components of the stone are fusing...Again: what is the magician's weapon?Now use it.No! Change me back into a sor- ceress, Willow.Wait! What about me!I'm supposed to be a beautiful wo= man.Not safe! Not safe!It does! It does! I will show you!Nockmaar! Nockmaar!This way! The cave!Look out!Tir Asleen.The Knights of the Pacalcade. The king's bravest warriors.Turn them back, Willow!Use the philosopher's stone! Hur- ry! Invocation! Release them!More! More!You didn't transform them, Willow, you released them. That was noth- ing. Now change me.I hate this.Willow! Get out of here! Quick! Hide!Get down! The ritual chant! Quick! Protect yourself!Just do it!It's over, Willow. You did well. You protected yourself.No! I can still defeat Bavmorda!A true magician, Willow, never surrenders. She is a sorceress--I am a sorceress! Transform me now and I will destroy her! Hexagram!Don't give up! Willow!We've got a lot of work to do, Wil- low. Bring in our brave men.By dawn, upon thirteen tolls of the runic drum!Bavmorda cannot transform you. I've protected this camp with a spell.Bavmorda has shielded it with a spell of her own.If we do not fight, and the baby dies, all hope for the future is lost. I shall face the danger alone if I have to.Time is running out.Patience, Willow.The baby will be queen. It has been foretold, Bavmorda.Not until your ritual is complete!There is no one who can match your sorcery. Except me!Willow...Willow...how...how did you do that?Willow Ufgood. Take this Book of Sorcery. You are on your way to becoming a great magician.
